title: Ingrown Nail Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Signs and Symptoms of an Ingrown Nail?
content: The signs and symptoms of an ingrown nail include:
bullets: Pain
Swelling
Redness around a toenail, usually the big toe
The sharp end of the nail will be pressing into the flesh on one or both sides of the nail.
Pus coming from the area around your nail
Bleeding
Your skin folds over the nail

content_blocks.text: The signs and symptoms of an ingrown nail include:
associated_bullets: Pain
Swelling
Redness around a toenail, usually the big toe
The sharp end of the nail will be pressing into the flesh on one or both sides of the nail.
Pus coming from the area around your nail
Bleeding
Your skin folds over the nail

sections.heading: When to Call Your Doctor About an Ingrown Nail
bullets: You have signs of infection, like severe pain or pus.
The pain doesn't go away after you treat the nail.
Your nails are so hard or thick that you can’t treat the nail.
You have diabetes , which raises your risk of complications from foot infections.

associated_bullets: You have signs of infection, like severe pain or pus.
The pain doesn't go away after you treat the nail.
Your nails are so hard or thick that you can’t treat the nail.
You have diabetes , which raises your risk of complications from foot infections.
